Despite similar sagittal alignment stability between groups at follow-up, patients with higher BMIs reported less postoperative pain relief and physical health improvements, indicating potential limitations in functional outcomes post-surgery.

The study underscores the importance of considering BMI as a critical factor influencing patient-reported outcomes and complication rates after ACDF, suggesting tailored surgical approaches or enhanced monitoring for higher-risk patients.
